entry.title: Prigozhin in Belarus as Wagner Prepares to Hand Over Weapons
entry.content: The announcement is an indication that the paramilitary group could be disbanded as an autonomous force in coming days.

entry.title: Why Wagner Chief Prigozhin Turned Against Putin
entry.content: Military infighting, financial pressures and personal political ambitions played into the brash decision.

entry.title: What's Happening With Wagner in Russia?
entry.content: Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin pulled back his forces from the brink of a bloody clash with the Russian army in Moscow that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

entry.title: Russian Turmoil Shows a Forever War Hurts Putin
entry.content: The Russian president bet he had more staying power than the West, but his Ukrainian quagmire now poses clear risks for Russiaâ€™s political stability.
